verses.text_plain: The burden of the desert of the sea. As whirlwinds in the south pass through; so it cometh from the desert, from a terrible land.
verses.verse_html: 1The burden of the desert of the sea. As whirlwinds in the south pass through; so it cometh from the desert, from a terrible land.

verses.text_plain: A grievous vision is declared unto me; the treacherous dealer dealeth treacherously, and the spoiler spoileth. Go up, O Elam: besiege, O Media; all the sighing thereof have I made to cease.
verses.verse_html:
2A grievous vision is declared unto me; the treacherous dealer dealeth treacherously, and the spoiler spoileth. Go up, O Elam: besiege, O Media; all the sighing thereof have I made to cease. ▼
▼ grievous: Heb. hard

tokens.text: thereof have I made to cease

verses.text_plain: Therefore are my loins filled with pain: pangs have taken hold upon me, as the pangs of a woman that travaileth: I was bowed down at the hearing of it; I was dismayed at the seeing of it.
verses.verse_html: 3Therefore are my loins filled with pain: pangs have taken hold upon me, as the pangs of a woman that travaileth: I was bowed down at the hearing of it; I was dismayed at the seeing of it.

verses.text_plain: My heart panted, fearfulness affrighted me: the night of my pleasure hath he turned into fear unto me.
verses.verse_html:
4My heart panted, fearfulness affrighted me: the night of my pleasure hath he turned into fear unto me. ▼
▼ heart…: or, mind wandered
 , ▼
▼ turned: Heb. put

footnotes.body_html: ▼ heart…: or, mind wandered

verses.text_plain: Prepare the table, watch in the watchtower, eat, drink: arise, ye princes, and anoint the shield.
verses.verse_html: 5Prepare the table, watch in the watchtower, eat, drink: arise, ye princes, and anoint the shield.

verses.text_plain: For thus hath the Lord said unto me, Go, set a watchman, let him declare what he seeth.
verses.verse_html: 6For thus hath the Lord said unto me, Go, set a watchman, let him declare what he seeth.

verses.text_plain: And he saw a chariot with a couple of horsemen, a chariot of asses, and a chariot of camels; and he hearkened diligently with much heed:
verses.verse_html: 7And he saw a chariot with a couple of horsemen, a chariot of asses, and a chariot of camels; and he hearkened diligently with much heed:

verses.text_plain: And he cried, A lion: My lord, I stand continually upon the watchtower in the daytime, and I am set in my ward whole nights:
verses.verse_html:
8And he cried, A lion: My lord, I stand continually upon the watchtower in the daytime, and I am set in my ward whole nights: ▼
▼ he…: or, cried as a lion
 , ▼
▼ whole…: or, every night

footnotes.body_text: ▼ he…: or, cried as a lion
footnotes.body_html: ▼ he…: or, cried as a lion
▼ whole…: or, every night

verses.text_plain: And, behold, here cometh a chariot of men, with a couple of horsemen. And he answered and said, Babylon is fallen, is fallen; and all the graven images of her gods he hath broken unto the ground.
verses.verse_html: 9And, behold, here cometh a chariot of men, with a couple of horsemen. And he answered and said, Babylon is fallen, is fallen; and all the graven images of her gods he hath broken unto the ground.

verses.text_plain: O my threshing, and the corn of my floor: that which I have heard of the Lord of hosts, the God of Israel, have I declared unto you.
verses.verse_html:
10O my threshing, and the corn of my floor: that which I have heard of the Lord of hosts, the God of Israel, have I declared unto you. ▼
▼ corn: Heb. son

verses.text_plain: The burden of Dumah. He calleth to me out of Seir, Watchman, what of the night? Watchman, what of the night?
verses.verse_html: 11The burden of Dumah. He calleth to me out of Seir, Watchman, what of the night? Watchman, what of the night?

verses.text_plain: The watchman said, The morning cometh, and also the night: if ye will enquire, enquire ye: return, come.
verses.verse_html: 12The watchman said, The morning cometh, and also the night: if ye will enquire, enquire ye: return, come.

verses.text_plain: The burden upon Arabia. In the forest in Arabia shall ye lodge, O ye travelling companies of Dedanim.
verses.verse_html: 13The burden upon Arabia. In the forest in Arabia shall ye lodge, O ye travelling companies of Dedanim.

verses.text_plain: The inhabitants of the land of Tema brought water to him that was thirsty, they prevented with their bread him that fled.
verses.verse_html:
14The inhabitants of the land of Tema brought water to him that was thirsty, they prevented with their bread him that fled. ▼
▼ brought: or, bring ye

footnotes.body_html: ▼ brought: or, bring ye

verses.text_plain: For they fled from the swords, from the drawn sword, and from the bent bow, and from the grievousness of war.
verses.verse_html:
15For they fled from the swords, from the drawn sword, and from the bent bow, and from the grievousness of war. ▼
▼ from the swords: or, for fear, etc: Heb. from the face, etc

footnotes.body_text: ▼ from the swords: or, for fear, etc: Heb. from the face, etc
footnotes.body_html: ▼ from the swords: or, for fear, etc: Heb. from the face, etc

verses.text_plain: For thus hath the Lord said unto me, Within a year, according to the years of an hireling, and all the glory of Kedar shall fail:
verses.verse_html: 16For thus hath the Lord said unto me, Within a year, according to the years of an hireling, and all the glory of Kedar shall fail:

verses.text_plain: And the residue of the number of archers, the mighty men of the children of Kedar, shall be diminished: for the Lord God of Israel hath spoken it.
verses.verse_html:
17And the residue of the number of archers, the mighty men of the children of Kedar, shall be diminished: for the Lord God of Israel hath spoken it. ▼
▼ archers: Heb. bows
